content.description:
This route ascends the wall immediately to the left of Tits Up.  This is a good TR after doing Tits.  Just place a directional.  The crux is a tease and hence explains the route's name.

TR

From Gooseberry Gully, hike north. Pass The Dead Zone and enter the Big Section. Just north of Tits up is a prominent, left facing corner. A very faded, yellow '16d' marks the route. This corner has very loose rock at its base. Traverse in from the left to stay safe. Above the loose junk is very clean and enjoyable climbing, including a wide crack that continues up the face to a roof. Traverse around the roof to clean finger locks and the wrap station at the guano ledge.

Protection: G.
No text - use the 'Improve This Page' link to add something useful!

This route is located roughly in the middle of the Big Section.  It is identified by a yellow '20' at its base.  The route starts by ascending a crispy face, aiming at 1 O'clock to a left facing corner.  The left facing corner continues to a large ledge, which is not the most obvious from the ground (good rest stance).  Finish by pulling the peel move to the left and zag back right to the tree and cliff top.

Trad.  The start of the route passes through questionable rock quality, but there is ample protection.  The quality of rock from the left facing corner to the cliff top is superb, with many quality moves.

This route ascends the wall immediately to the right of Tits Up.  This is a good TR after doing Tits.  Just place a directional below and to the right of the tree in a solid crack.  The route is easy for its grade with only one 5.7 move.

TR

This is very accessible trad route that is superb for the introductory trad climber. The route hosts two variations that are technically straight forward and easy to protect. From GooseBerry Gully walk north. Pass The Dead Zone area and enter The Big Section. You will make a slight turn left. The numbers 19A and 19B will be painted in yellow on the rock. These markings simply denote different starts to the route. Both variations are 5.7 and converge at a roof, of which a crack bisects. Pull the roof and traverse right at 1 O'clock to the wrap station. Protection: G.
There exists a sling anchor at the top to rappel from.

This is yet another, classic Mt. Nemo technically straight forward, accessible and easy to protect route for the introductory trad climber. Heck, everyone should climb it. It is just plain fun. From GooseBerry Gully walk north. Pass The Dead Zone. You will come to a left facing corner that rises approximately 4 meters. Atop the left facing corner is a crack the ascends the majority of the face. A small overhang sits atop the crack. The route is marked with a yellow '16D.' The original name of the route is unknown and so we arbitrarily gave it its present name. Protection: G.
Just when it starts feeling difficult, it will start getting easier.
The big Section is one of the southern areas at Mt. Nemo.
